content.name: Local Content & Government Procurement Authority
content.text: The “mandatory list” is a list of national products that the contractor must commit to purchase from national manufacturers in conjunction with a government agency. The list aims to develop national industries and products that have the ability to meet the needs of government projects.

content.name: Supply Competitions:
list: The competitor is obligated to present product origin, whether it is national or foreign.

The offer where the competitor did not comply with the mandatory list shall be excluded, and in the event that the competition is divisible, then the items in which the competitor did not abide by the mandatory list shall be excluded in the supply contracts.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Local Content & Government Procurement Authority for more details:

enablerItem.name: The Price Premium for National Products
enablerItem.nameIn: The Price Premium for National Products

content.name: Local Content & Government Procurement Authority
content.text: This mechanism aims to give a price preference to national products. This is directly applied by the government agency in the supply contracts, and the contractor is obligated to apply it in his contracts with his subcontractors. At the end of the contract, the contractor submits a report confirming his commitment to the share of national products during the contract period. Fines are also imposed on the contractor in the event of default in the share of national products.

content.name: Mechanism Characteristics:
list: The national product is granted a price premium, by assuming the price of the foreign product 10% higher than indicated in the bid.
The premium rate may be increased through an agreement between LCGPA and the Center of Spending Efficiency, provided that the modified rate is explicitly stated in the tender documents.
This mechanism applies to products not included in the mandatory list.
This mechanism applies either directly or indirectly.
Direct application: through the government agency in the supply contracts where national products are preferred. Also during the evaluation phase of offers according to the price preference equation.

Indirect application: through the contractor with the government agency in all contracts other than supply. Giving preference to national products when purchasing materials or tools. Also, the contractor is obligated to apply the price preference mechanism in his contracts with his subcontractors.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Local Content & Government Procurement Authority for more details:

content.name: Local Content & Government Procurement Authority
content.text: This mechanism aims to define a minimum required for local content at the project level. It applies to some projects, determined by the Local Content and Governmental Procurement Authority and the Spending Efficiency Center. It is applied to high-value contracts. Competitors provide a percentage of local content, no less than the minimum required, and must clarify whether or not the company is listed in their submitted offers. This is included in the financial evaluation according to an equation that determines the winner of the competition.

content.name: Mechanism Characteristics:
content.text: In the financial evaluation, this mechanism grants a price weight equivalent to 60%. The remaining 40% includes:
list: Baseline for local content.
Target local content percentage.
Being listed in the market.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Local Content & Government Procurement Authority for more details:

enablerItem.name: Local Content Score in Commercial Evaluation
enablerItem.nameIn: Local Content Score in Commercial Evaluation

content.name: Local Content & Government Procurement Authority
content.text: This mechanism allocates weight to the local content and to companies listed on the financial market during the financial evaluation phase. An accounting formula determines the highest-ranking competitor.

content.name: Mechanism Characteristics:
content.text: In the financial evaluation, this mechanism grants a price weight equivalent to 60%. The remaining 40% includes:
list: Baseline for local content.
Target local content percentage.
Being listed in the market.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Local Content & Government Procurement Authority for more details:

enablerItem.name: The contracting method of localization of industries and knowledge transfer
enablerItem.nameIn: The contracting method of localization of industries and knowledge transfer

content.name: Local Content & Government Procurement Authority
content.text: Industry localization and knowledge transfer agreements are agreements directed to investors who own leading technologies around the world to motivate them to transfer technology and knowledge to the Kingdom in exchange for a government purchase guarantee, the percentage and duration of which are agreed upon according to a feasibility study that considers the investment returns on the government commitment as well as on the investor.

content.name: ECONOMICAL IMPACT:
list: Developing local content through the impact of the establishment of factories by major international companies within the Kingdom as well as creating jobs, transferring knowledge, and creating new local supply chains.
Attracting foreign investments.
Reducing dependence on imported products and creating new opportunities to export local products.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Local Content & Government Procurement Authority for more details:

content.name: Ministry Of Industry & Minerals Resources
content.text: Exemption of an industrial facility that has an industrial license from customs duties on its imports of raw materials, finished goods, semi-finished goods, packaging materials, machinery, and spare parts necessary for direct production.

content.name: Application conditions:
list: Valid industrial license
Valid commercial registration matching the industrial license
The customs items for the goods required for exemption must be registered within the industrial license
The quantity of requested materials should not exceed the licensed production capacity of the factory

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Ministry of Industry & Minerals Resources for more details:

link.name: Ministry of Industry & Minerals Resources Website

enablerItem.name: Value-Added Tax Exemption for Military Industries
enablerItem.nameIn: Value-Added Tax Exemption for Military Industries

content.name: General Authority For Military Industries - GAMI
content.text: Military factories licensed by the General Authority for Military Industries are exempted from value-added tax.

content.name: Requirements:
list: The entity must have a license from GAMI.
The produced products are classified as a good for military applications.
The product(s) are being supplied to all sections of the Armed Forces and the Internal Security Forces in the Kingdom.
Meeting all requirements and regulations of Zakat, Tax and Customs Authority.

content.name: SABIC Company
content.text: In order to achieve SABIC’s localization agenda and local industry development, SABIC is initiating “Nusaned” –its first integrated localization engine to achieve Saudi Vision 2030.

content.name: The initiative offers:
list: Obtaining raw materials from SABIC.
Technology and technical support.
Developing workforce capabilities.
Organizational support.
Industrial consulting.
Knowledge, studies, and statistics.
Financial empowerment.
Business and marketing support.
Discount and incentives.

content.name: Saudi Aramco
content.text: Iktva (in kingdom total value add) provides a level playing field for suppliers through consistency and transparency in application and process. Uniform evaluations for both service and material suppliers will be consistent across the company, creating supplier-focused partnerships, and investment stability and assurance achieved through annual assessments. moreover, iktva program has the potential to help companies develop new products, services and technologies through partnerships in and outside of the Kingdom.

content.name: How does it work?
content.text: You can visit the website of Iktva program for more details:
list: The program will first establish an iktva baseline score for each supplier measured against key metrics for local value creation.
Your company and Saudi Aramco can work together develop a 5-year iktva action plan to improve your iktva ratio.

content.name: Opportunities platform
content.text: Investment Opportunities Platform promotes the establishment of state-of-the-art local manufacturing facilities in Saudi Arabia to comply with local content requirements. The annual opportunity size exceeds $16B. National Companies and Tier-1 OEMs/EPC contractors are encouraged to buy locally manufactured goods and services in order to meet the iktva targets which will benefit the potential investors.You can visit the website of Iktva program for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: Given the challenges facing these establishments in the industrial sector, a team of specialized consultants at the Saudi Industrial Development Fund intends to provide support to them by exploring appropriate opportunities to improve performance, achieve growth, and ensure sustainability.

content.name: Services Provided
content.text: Improving Cost Efficiency:
list: Analysis of direct and indirect costs.
Analysis of the company’s costs compared to the market.
Analysis of raw material costs, suppliers, the procurement process, and more.
Providing recommendations to improve the market strategy.
Providing advice on sales and market strategy by studying prices and product mix.
Analysis of market share, target customers, sales channels, and customer segmentation.
Conducting a diagnostic analysis of the establishment’s operations and production processes.
Identifying the factors that pose challenges in the production processes.
Providing recommendations on how to enhance manufacturing efficiency based on standard studies and best practices.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: In line with supporting promising small and medium-sized industrial enterprises, the SME Scale-Up product was launched to provide financial facilities to SMEs with proven success records. This allows them to increase their production capacity and reach the growth and expansion that resonates with their aspirations. This offering is available for both new and existing SIDF investors.

content.name: Initiative Requirements:
list: Brownfield projects with three years of audited financials.
Increase in revenue or volume sold.
Terms and conditions apply.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Longer tenure of 8 years.
Longer grace period of up to 24 months.
Possibility to reduce net worth requirement to 50% of the loan amount.
Upfront disbursement of 30% of the loan amount.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund-SIDF
content.text: Tawteen program is set to facilitate, enhance, and finance supply chain localization opportunities of the Kingdom’s industrial sector. To achieve this, SIDF established partnerships with leading companies in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia to enable the switch to source locally manufactured products and spare parts. Through preferential financing solutions, the Tawteen program will help stimulate investment activities and support the national and local content strategy.

content.name: Tawteen Objectives:
list: Stimulate domestic and foreign investments to increase local content.
Highlight localization opportunities.
Measure and maximize SIDF Local Content contribution.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Longer tenure of a minimum of 7 years.
Longer grace period of up to 24 months.
Fast track for projects with purchase agreements.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: In collaboration with Commercial Banks, SIDF has introduced the Letter of Credit as a default payment mechanism to Clients with preferred terms and conditions.

content.name: Objectives:
list: Better liquidity management.
Project implementation acceleration.
Lower Issuance fees.

content.name: Roles of Each Party:
content.text:
The Client: Contractual agreement between client and supplier. 
 SIDF: Provide a guarantee to issue the Letter of Credit with terms and conditions. 
 The Bank: Issues Letter of Credit and validates shipping documents.

content.name: Success Partners:
list: Riyad Bank
Bank AlJazira
Samba bank
Al Inma bank
Banque Saudi Fransi
SABB
Bank Albilad

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: Financing the incremental working capital needs (account receivables, inventory and account payables) to aid the growth of projects by extending short-term loans with a maximum financing tenure of one year.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Simplified and quick evaluation process.
No additional security required.
Upfront disbursement.

content.name: General Eligibility Criteria:
list: To be an Existing Client of SIDF.
Operational for at least 18 months.
Proven need of working capital.
Satisfactory relationship with SIDF.
Existing loan to be fully disbursed.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: The Saudi Industrial Development Fund has launched phase one of the Acquisition Finance Product, which aims to fund acquisitions for local companies to acquire local targets in SIDF financed sectors with a clear added value to Saudi Arabia.

content.name: Applicable Acquisitions for Financing:
list: Financing the acquisition of a specific technology, a method of manufacture, or intellectual property.
Financing the acquisition of a supplier or clients to achieve integration in cost or revenues.
Financing the acquisition of a competitor for the integration and development of offers.

content.name: Financing Options:
list: Pre-acquisition financing
Post-acquisition financing

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: SIDF finances capital expenditures aimed at improving the operational value of the project, including production lines, services, buildings, IT systems, safety equipment upgrades, vehicles, and warehouses.

content.name: Requirements:
list: Assure a non-increase of the production capacity of the project.
Produce a clear positive impact on improving the operational value of the project.
The company should be financially solvent enough to repay the SIDF loan and with a track record of profits in the last two years.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Medium-term financing for a maximum period of 5 years.
30% upfront disbursement of the loan.
Fast assessment track.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: SIDF offers this service to projects, through a set of different requirements, procedures, and stages, ranging from short to long term loans for various purposes.

content.name: Applicable Projects:
list: New Industrial Projects.
Expansion Projects for Existing Facilities.
Upgrade Projects for Existing Facilities.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Financing for a period up to 20 years.
Financing up to 75% of the project total cost.
Grace period up to 18 months.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

enablerItem.name: We Finance, You Manufacture Initiative
enablerItem.nameIn: National Industrial Development and Logistic Program & Riyadh Bank

content.name: Localizing high priority production in five sectors:
list: Balance of payments.
Pharmaceuticals & medical devices.
Machinery & equipment.
Food processing.
Transportation & logistic services.

content.name: Initiative Privileges:
list: Enhancing ease of business indicators.
Increasing local content.
Support localization of manufacturing.
Marketing support.
Incentives & benefits.
Flexible repayment periods.
Special prices.

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund-SIDF
content.text: Short-term financing to facilitate early invoice payments that aims to support working capital needs and​ improve cashflows.

content.name: Advantages of Supply Chain Financing Product:
list: Simplified assessment process
Longer credit terms to the buyer
Early payments on suppliers’ invoices
Shorter cash conversion cycle for the buyers and their suppliers
Stronger and better relationship between buyers and their suppliers

content.name: Product Eligibility Criteria for the Buyer:
list: No current past dues or FUF (SIDF client)
Good relationship (SIDF client)
Clean SIMAH report
Audited financials for the last 3 years
Profitable in the last 3 years

enablerItem.name: Guarantee Program to Support Working Capital Needs
enablerItem.nameIn: Guarantee Program to Support Working Capital Needs

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund-SIDF
content.text: A guarantee provided by SIDF to a financing entity or an industrial company, to support small and medium enterprises in obtaining credit facilities from Financial Institutions or enhanced credit terms from Corporate Creditors. The aim of the program is to support SIDF clients through the program partners.

content.name: Program Paths:

list: SAB
Banque Saudi Fransi
Riyad Bank
Arab National Bank

content.name: Benefits:
list: Obtain credit facilities from financial institutions (Guarantee to support working capital needs Path )
Improve credit terms with corporate creditors (Trade Finance guarantee path)​​
Guarantee duration reaches 24 months

content.name: Beneficiary:
list: Existing and operational
Satisfactory relationship with SIDF (if existing)
Audited financial statements for the last 3 years
Proven need of working capital
Profitable company for the last two years

content.name: Saudi Authority For Industrial Cities And Technology Zones (MODON)
content.text: In collaboration with Dinar Investment Company, MODON offers financial solutions to its investors for quick and flexible financing.

content.name: Invoice Financing::
list: Financing against invoices, or extracts and receivables of the company.
Financing design according to the invoice structure.
Financing up to 10 million Saudi Riyals.
Receiving the full financing amount.
Easy periodic repayment installments.

content.name: Working Capital Financing:
list: Enhancing the company’s liquidity.
Quick financing with approval within 3 working days.​
Financing up to 30 million Saudi Riyals.
Flexible financing design according to the company’s business.
Flexible cash payments.
Competitive profit margin.

content.name: Expansion Financing::
list: Financing expansion projects.
Long-term financing up to 10 years.
Receiving the full financing amount.
Easy periodic repayment installments.
Competitive profit margin.

content.name: Saudi Authority For Industrial Cities And Technology Zones (MODON)
content.text: In collaboration with Sukuk Capital, MODON offers innovative financing solutions with flexible repayment features, to enhance the contribution of the entrepreneurship sector and small and medium enterprises in developing the national economy.

content.name: Solutions:
list: Working capital for factories.
Capital projects for factories.
Bridge financing for factories.
Acquisition financing for factories.

content.name: Advantages:
list: Flexible repayment schedules.
Fast financing process.
Diverse financial products.
Financing with various terms.

content.name: The Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu – RCJY
content.text: In collaboration with Sukuk Financial Company, the Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu offers financing solutions to enhance cooperation in financing industrial companies operating in the Royal Commission cities.

content.name: Advantages:
list: Easier financing: Industrial companies will be able to obtain facilitated financing through dedicated funding.
Provision of land: Sukuk Financial will work on providing the necessary land and facilities for the companies being financed.
Attracting investments: This initiative will contribute to attracting more investments to the industrial sector in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

enablerItem.name: Saudi Authority for Industrial Cities and Technology Zones
enablerItem.nameIn: Saudi Authority for Industrial Cities and Technology Zones

content.name: Saudi Authority for Industrial Cities and Technology Zones(MODON)
content.text: MODON oversees more than 36 industrial cities. Each industrial city has a field administration that supervises the daily needs of investors and supervises the operation and maintenance of the site and the construction projects in the industrial city. Moon has introduced different products that enhance its role and responsibility as one of the pillars of national industry empowerment and leadership.

content.name: Industrial Lands:
content.text: MODON provides developed infrastructure and services such as electricity, water and others in different areas in all regions of the Kingdom that meet the needs of industrial investors.

content.name: Ready-Built Factories:
content.text: MODON provides ready-built factories for investor partners who own small and medium enterprises. It has equipped production halls targeting clean and light industries.

enablerItem.name: Royal Commission of Jubail and Yanbu
enablerItem.nameIn: Royal Commission of Jubail and Yanbu

content.name: Royal Commission of Jubail and Yanbu
content.text: The Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu supervises the operation of 4 industrial cities in each of Jubail, Yanbu, Jizan and Ras al-Khair. Meeting highest international standards to be the best option for investors in the petrochemical and energy-intensive industries. RCJY follows Comprehensive Management methods, leading the way for the Kingdom and the Arab region. The Royal Commission oversees nine sectors, namely; comprehensive planning, basic infrastructure, operation and maintenance, investment promotion, security and safety, health and community service, education, workforce training, and environmental protection.

enablerItem.name: Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority
enablerItem.nameIn: Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority

content.name: Economic Cities And Special Zones Authority (ECZA)
content.text: ECZA enhances the Kingdom’s global competitiveness by launching and enabling a range of cities and special economic zones that provide an attractive regulatory environment for investment. ECZA supports targeted competitive incentives and enablers, highly efficient integrated government services, and a stimulating living environment with global quality of life standards. The lunch took place in four special economic zones, including:

content.name: 1- King Abdullah Economic City (KAEC) SEZ
content.text: Sectors of Opportunity:
list: Automobile supply chain and assembly.
Consumer goods.
ICT (Electronic light manufacturing).
Pharmaceuticals.
MedTech.
Logistics.

content.name: 2- Ras Al-Khair Special Economic Zone
content.text: Sectors of Opportunity:
list: Shipbuilding and MRO.
Rig platforms and MRO.

content.name: 3- Jazan Special Economic Zone
content.text: Sectors of Opportunity:
list: Food processing.
Metals conversion.
Logistic.

content.name: 4- Cloud Computing SEZ
content.text: Sectors of Opportunity:
list: Cloud computing.

content.name: Access Attractive Economic Incentives Across the SEZ Network:
list: Corporate income tax reductions.
A variety of withholding tax exemptions.
Deferred customs duties on goods entering the SEZ.
Expat levy ensuring fees exemption for employees and their families in the zone.
VAT exemptions based on sector/activity criteria.
Flexible and supportive regulations around foreign talent.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority (ECZA) for more details:

link.name: Economic Cities And Special Zones Authority Website

content.name: Human Resources Development Fund
content.text: A program to provide training support to private sector establishments to raise the skills of their employees. This meets the needs of the private sector through electronic training, in cooperation with government agencies and academics.

content.name: Admission Requirements:
list: Targeted Employees to be Saudi Nationality.
Age not be less than 18 years and not more than 60 years old.
To be registered in the national portal - TAQAT.
Non-government employee - according to the data of the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development.
Should not have previously benefited from the Momaken program.
The eligibility of an individual benefiting from the program is not affected by the Fund’s support in other programs.

content.name: The Training Program:
content.text: Training is provided electronically and is carried out by training agencies and governmental bodies. It includes all activities, methods and training enablers within the Skills Program, which aims to provide the targeted group with the knowledge, skills and experience necessary. It supports them in performing their job tasks and offers greater stability in them.

content.name: Human Resources Development Fund
content.text: An employment support program provided by the Human Resources Development Fund. The program aims to support research and jobseekers in the private sector. The fund bears a percentage of the employee’s wages, and includes support for all the jobs in the private sector for full-time and remote work. The program adds additional support in regions and cities with fewer job opportunities, less female employment. It provides support to persons with disabilities, and is for small, medium and micro enterprises.

content.name: Targeted Entities:
content.text: All private sector entities are subject to the support provided through this program, unless they are suspended by the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development of the Human Resources Development Fund. The minimum wage is 3200 riyals. The maximum wage is 15,000 riyals, according to social insurance records. The duration of support period extends to two years.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Human Resources Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Human Resources Development Fund
content.text: The Tamheer program is an on-the-job training program for Saudi graduates from local and foreign universities and graduates of institutes and colleges who hold technical, health, and administrative diplomas. It aims to train them in government institutions and distinguished companies in the private sector so that they can acquire the expertise and skills necessary to prepare them to participate in the labor market.

content.name: Targeted Entities:
content.text: The applicant/trainee has to be:
list: A Saudi Citizen
Holding bachelor degree or higher, or holding of technical, health or administrative diploma.
The social insurance records at the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development should indicate that the applicant has not been registered for any job during the previous six months.
Not currently employed.
Applying for the program for the first time.

content.name: Program Benefits:
list: A financial reward of (3000) riyals per month for the trainee for bachelor's degree holders and above, and a financial reward of (2000) riyals per month for the trainee for holders of technical, health and administrative diplomas, provided by the Human Resources Development Fund.
Insurance against occupational hazards.
Electronic training courses.
Experience certificate provided by the Human Resources Development Fund after completing the training program.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Human Resources Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: Provide financial facilities for small and medium enterprises to increase production capacity and deliver the growth and expansion that resonates with investor’s aspirations.

content.name: Program Products and Services:
list: Support growth of promising projects (established projects).
Collaboration with business accelerators.
Collaboration with other financing institutions (Social Development Fund).

content.name: The Program Offers the Following:
list: Longer tenure (minimum of 8 years).
Longer grace period (up to 24 months).
Possibility to reduce net worth requirement to 50% of the loan amount.
Upfront disbursement of 30% of the loan amount.

content.name: Program Objectives:
list: Encourage and support small and medium projects to grow.
Build local capabilities.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Small & Medium Enterprises Loan Guarantee Program - Kafalah
content.text: The program provides effective guarantees to stimulate financing and support small and medium enterprises (SMEs) that contribute to strengthening the national economy. İt also provides financial guarantees to enhance enterprise access to the necessary financing through strategic partnerships, national cadres, and innovative and knowledge-based technical tools.

content.name: Objectives:
list: Encouraging financial institutions to engage with the SME sector.
Supporting SMEs in accessing appropriate financing.
Attracting a new segment of SME owners.

content.name: Saudi Venture Capital Company
content.text: ‘Monshaat’ has launched the Venture Capital Initiative, one of the initiatives designed to stimulate the private sector, which aims to stimulate venture investments by investing in funds as well as co-investing with angel groups for the primary goal of minimizing equity financing gaps for startups and SMEs. Saudi Venture Capital Company was founded in 2018 to implement the objectives of this initiative.

content.name: Objectives:
list: Supporting start-up companies and investment funds.
Creating an investment ecosystem with targeted practices to bridge financing gaps and achieve economic integration.
Creating a successful investment environment by stimulating the private sector to invest in promising start-up companies.

content.textDone: You can visit Saudi Venture Capital Company website for more details:

content.name: Small & Medium Enterprises General Authority - Monshaat
content.text: A service provided by the General Authority for SMEs ‘Monshaat’ among private sector stimulating initiatives, and in cooperation with the Social Development Bank to provide low-cost loans to finance companies licensed by the Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency, which provides financing solutions with competitive advantages for small and medium enterprises.

content.name: Program Objective:
list: Promoting lending to micro, small and medium enterprises by providing low-cost loans.

content.textDone: You can visit Monshaat website for more details:

link.name: Small & Medium Enterprises General Authority (Monshaat) Website

content.name: Small & Medium Enterprises General Authority - Monshaat
content.text: An e-service that qualifies and empowers small and medium-sized enterprises by linking them to the purchasing opportunities of the public and private sectors and facilitating access of enterprises to purchasing opportunities to ensure growth and market opening.

content.textDone: You can visit Monshaat website for more details:

link.name: Small & Medium Enterprises General Authority (Monshaat) Website

content.name: Small & Medium Enterprises General Authority - Monshaat
content.text: In an effort to reach entrepreneurs and SMEs owners in all cities and governorates of the Kingdom, the General Authority for SMEs has created an application called "Monshaat’s Windows" to provide guidance and counselling services. The application aims to increase enterprise success and stability and to enable enterprises to overcome challenges by providing specialized advisers and mentors with business expertise.

content.name: Objectives:
list: Reducing the failure rate or drop-out from the market through counseling and appropriate solutions by specialized advisers.
Supporting entrepreneurs throughout the Kingdom.
Increasing success rate for SMEs and enabling them to achieve stability, growth and overcome challenges.

content.textDone: You can visit Monshaat website for more details:

link.name: Small & Medium Enterprises General Authority (Monshaat) Website

content.text: Through it, it reduces the personal guarantees and financial solvency required to obtain financing, enabling entrepreneurs to start their industrial activities by creating innovative investment and financing tools.

content.name: Targeted Groups:
list: Small and medium enterprises.
Entrepreneurs.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Soft loans (without asking for personal guarantees or mortgaging the investor's property).
Diversifying the investment tools available to entrepreneurs and small and medium enterprises.

enablerItem.name: Funding Products
enablerItem.nameIn: Small and Medium Enterprises Bank (SMEs Bank)

content.name: 1. Working Capital Loan
content.text: This type of financing is targeting Micro, Small, and medium enterprises [whose annual revenues do not exceed SAR 200 million and the number of employees not exceeding 250]

content.name: Loan Purpose:
content.text: Fulfilling Short-Term Financing needs: & to cover short-term expenses including the following:
list: Operating expenses including Rent, Utilities, Salaries to employees (Full-time/Part-time), Transportation, and other short-term liabilities
Raw Material and finished goods purchases

content.name: Main Features:
list: All sectors inclusive
minimum of 1 year for Active CR
Financing up to 15 million SAR
Financing tenor up to 12 months

content.name: 2. Term Loan
content.text: This type of financing is targeting Micro, Small, and medium enterprises [whose annual revenues do not exceed SAR 200 million and the number of employees not exceeding 250]

content.name: Loan Purpose:
content.text: Fulfilling Medium-Term Financing & The purpose of Term Loans is to provide medium-term financing for SMEs, including fixed assets purchases and business expansion

content.name: Main Features:
list: All sectors inclusive
Minimum of 2 years for Active CR
Financing tenor up to 36 months
Grace period up to 6 months

content.name: 3. Revolving Limit Loan
content.text: This type of financing is targeting Micro, Small, and medium enterprises [whose annual revenues do not exceed SAR 200 million and the number of employees not exceeding 250] with a revolving Credit limit that is re-initiated and set once the entire loan part has been paid

content.name: Main Features:
content.text: This type of financing is targeting Micro, Small, and medium enterprises [whose annual revenues do not exceed SAR 200 million and the number of employees not exceeding 250] with a revolving Credit limit that is re-initiated and set once the entire loan part has been paid
list: All industries are inclusive
Financing up to 8 million SAR
Financing tenor up to 12 months
Minimum of 1 year for Active CR

enablerItem.name: Guarantee Program to Support Working Capital Needs

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund-SIDF
content.text: A guarantee provided by SIDF to a financing entity or an industrial company, to support small and medium enterprises in obtaining credit facilities from Financial Institutions or enhanced credit terms from Corporate Creditors. The aim of the program is to support SIDF clients through the program partners.

content.name: Program Paths:
content.text: Guarantee to support working capital needs path through commercial banks:
list: SAB
Banque Saudi Fransi
Riyad Bank
Arab National Bank

content.text: Trade finance guarantee path to improve sales through our industrial company partner:
list: Tasnee

content.name: Benefits:
list: Obtain credit facilities from financial institutions (Guarantee to support working capital needs Path )
Improve credit terms with corporate creditors (Trade Finance guarantee path)​​
Guarantee duration reaches 24 months

content.name: Beneficiary:
list: Existing and operational
Satisfactory relationship with SIDF (if existing)
Audited financial statements for the last 3 years
Proven need of working capital
Profitable company for the last two years
content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Small & Medium Enterprises General Authority – Monshaat
content.text: Specialized centers in emerging technologies, working to empower establishments and entrepreneurs and contribute to achieving the Kingdom’s Vision 2030, by contributing to the creation of innovative startups, and increasing the efficiency of small and medium-sized enterprises. The centers aim to enable the small and medium enterprises sector to employ advanced technologies to develop these establishments and increase their competitiveness, and to be a link between entrepreneurs and decision-makers in their specialized fields.

content.name: Center Services:
list: Thakaa Challenges: Challenges aimed at encouraging entrepreneurs and talented individuals to find innovative solutions that serve business owners and government entities.
Thakaa Pioneers: An intensive two-month program to empower innovative startups and distinguished existing establishments by providing direct guidance and performance evaluation by experts.
Thakaa Camps: A series of intensive courses in a single training camp specialized in one of various sectors, ranging from 3 days to a week in duration.

Workshops: Interactive lectures that introduce you to ways of using potential technical solutions for establishments to enhance innovation. Workshops are either in-person at the center or through live online broadcast.
Thakaa Consultations: Free consultations provided by experts and consultants in the center’s fields, offering solutions for modeling and launching initial products in the market.
Thakaa Meetings: Monthly meetings hosted by the Thakaa center, rich in dialogues and discussions for knowledge and experience exchange.
Thakaa Library: Explore diverse digital learning resources such as brochures, articles, and registered workshops in the fields of entrepreneurship and technology.

Thakaa Opportunities: Your opportunity to innovate smart, scalable solutions for various products and projects based on emerging technologies provided by Thakaa Center experts in partnership with public and private entities.
Thakaa Plus: Support your promising business through exclusive and diverse services. Be one of the beneficiaries and develop your establishment.
content.textDone: You can visit Monshaat website for more details:

link.name: Small & Medium Enterprises General Authority Website

content.name: National Industrial Development and Logistics Program – NIDLP
content.text: It aims to empower entrepreneurship in the industry and logistics services sector, to contribute to achieving the ambitions of Saudi Vision 2030 by providing a package of enablers and incentives to support investment opportunities.

content.name: Incentives:
list: Financial incentives.
Feasibility studies.
Industrial land / Ready-made factory.
Presentation to investors.
Market entry.

enablerItem.name: Tanafusiya Program for Industrial Digital Transformation

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: Enhance productivity through automation, digitization , and implementation of industry 4.0.

content.name: The initiative requirements:
list: For new and existing clients with a good standing.
Brownfield projects that can provide financial statements for the last three years.
Project’s ability to prove reducing energy consumption or energy cost.
Commercially proven technology.
Provide a feasibility study with reasonable Capex and OpeX projections.
SIDF terms and conditions apply.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Longer tenor (minimum of 7 years).
Grace period that extends up to 24 months.
aster turnaround time within 8 weeks.
Specialized advisory services.

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: In line with supporting promising small and medium-sized industrial enterprises, the SME Scale-Up product was launched to provide financial facilities to SMEs with proven success records to allow them to increase their production capacity and reach the growth and expansion that resonates with their aspirations. This offering is available for both new and existing SIDF investors.

content.name: The Initiative Requirements:
list: Brownfield projects with three years of audited financials.
Increase in revenue or volume sold.
Terms and conditions apply.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Longer tenure of a minimum of 7 years.
Longer grace period of up 24 months.
Fast track for projects with purchase agreements.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: NIDLP program and Ministry of Communications and Information Technology
content.text: Initiative aimed at accelerating innovation and adopting emerging technologies, products, services, and local technological solutions within targeted sectors by providing digital incentives

content.name: Initiative Tracks:
list: Adoption of digital capabilities
Adoption of emerging technologies

content.name: Target Audience:
list: Private sector
Technology companies

content.name: Initiative Objectives:
list: Assist establishments in enhancing productivity
Improve quality through the use of Fourth Industrial Revolution technologies
Reduce costs and enhance innovation and diversity
Adapt to changes in the era of advanced technology
Utilize artificial intelligence and analytics for quality control and data analysis to identify potential defects in the production process and improve them

link.name: Technology Adoption Incentives | Ministry of Communications and Information Technology

enablerItem.name: The launch of the Fourth Industrial Revolution Capabilities Center

content.name: NIDLP Program, KACST, and MODON
content.text: The National Industrial Development and Logistics Program (NIDLP) has been launched in partnership with King Abdulaziz City for Science and Technology and the Saudi Authority for Industrial Cities and Technology Zones (MODON). The operational phase of the Fourth Industrial Revolution Capabilities Center in the Second Industrial City in Riyadh aims to develop innovative solutions to enhance the competitiveness of factories in line with the goals of Saudi Vision 2030

content.name: The program aims to support factories in
list: Monitoring operations to improve production planning and predictive maintenance
Making more intelligent decisions
Using 3D printing technology to reduce costs and delivery time

link.name: The Fourth Industrial Revolution Center Website

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: Which aims to apply techniques that reduce energy consumption, using energy auditing and management systems to support continuous improvements of energy performance such as; energy efficiency, energy security, and energy consumption.

content.name: Requirement:
list: For new and existing clients with a good standing.
Brownfield projects that can provide financial statements for the last three years.
Project’s ability to prove reducing energy consumption or energy cost.
Commercially proven technology.
Provide a feasibility study with reasonable Capex and Opex projections.
SIDF Terms and conditions apply.

list: Longer tenor (minimum of 7 years).
Grace period that extends up to 24 months.

enablerItem.name: Basic Digitization Solutions Initiative for Factories

content.name: Ministry Of Industry & Mineral Resources
content.text: Providing grants to factories to implement basic digitization and automation solutions, which are considered a requirement for advanced digitization and automation solutions and do not usually require large capital investments. These solutions include digitizing procedures, planning, communication systems, production line control, material handling systems, and packaging machines.

content.name: Eligibility Criteria:
list: The factory must be established and productive.
The factory must have obtained all necessary government licenses.
The type of investment for the facility should be (industrial).
The client must be a small or medium-sized factory and must obtain a certificate from the General Authority for Small and Medium Enterprises “Monsha’at” to prove this.
The factory must have conducted a thorough assessment.
It should be within the scope of basic digitization: solutions for digitizing procedures and planning.
The solution or technology used should not have been previously implemented in the factory.
The required solution or technology must be economically viable.
The company implementing the solutions or technologies for the client must have a valid commercial registration issued by the competent authority in the Kingdom.

content.name: Required Documents:
list: Industrial license certificate for the factory
Monsha’at certificate
Return on investment form
Factory summary form
Thorough assessment (SIRI assessment)
Factory application form for the initiative (“Factory offers from each service provider”)

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Ministry of Industry & Minerals Resources for more details:

link.name: Ministry Of Industry & Minerals Resources Website

content.name: Saudi Exports Development Authority
content.text: The Saudi Export Incentive Program aims to encourage Saudi companies to enter and expand export markets, as the program offers nine incentives that are compatible with the requirements of the World Trade Organization, covering the costs borne by Saudi companies in the different stages of their export activities.

content.name: Products and Services:
list: Individual Participation in Trade Fairs: Saudi Exports will provide this incentive to reimburse 65% of the fees up to ceiling of 150,000 SAR.
Legal Support: Saudi Exports will provide this incentive to reimburse 85% of the fees up to a ceiling of 100,000 SAR.
Marketing and Advertising: Saudi Exports will provide this incentive to reimburse 75% of the fees up to a ceiling of 200,000 SAR.
Product Certifications: Saudi Exports will provide this incentive to reimburse 50% of the fees up to a ceiling of 250,000 SAR.
Advisory Supply Chain & Export Strategy: Reimbursement of 55% of fees up to ceiling of 255,000 SAR.
Potential Buyer Visit Support: Saudi Exports will provide this incentive to reimburse 90% of the fees up to 50,000 SAR.
E-commerce Listing: Saudi Exports will provide this incentive to reimburse 70% of the fees up to a ceiling of 55,000 SAR.
Product Registration: Saudi Exports will provide this incentive to reimburse 50% of the fees up to ceiling of 55,000 SAR.
Specialized Training: Saudi Exports will provide this intensive to reimburse 55% of the fees up to a ceiling of 50,000 SAR.

content.name: Saudi Export-Import Bank
content.text: Established in 2020 with the aim of achieving the targets of Saudi Vision 2030, the Saudi Export-Import Bank seeks to enhance the non-oil Saudi economy and increase the share of non-oil exports in the total GDP. The bank works towards developing non-oil Saudi exports, enhancing their competitiveness in global markets, bridging financial gaps, and mitigating risks faced by exporters. The bank is one of the development funds under the Saudi National Development Fund. It is committed to its developmental role by integrating with governmental institutions to achieve national strategies and strengthen national companies to foster a diverse and comprehensive economy. It focuses on building international economic and trade partnerships and accessing targeted and promising markets. The bank offers a range of financial products, guarantees, and export credit insurance with competitive advantages, aiming to boost confidence in Saudi products, increase the economic contribution of non-oil exports, and expand their presence in regional and global markets.

content.name: Products and Services:
list: Line of Credit (Domestic): ​​​​The bank seeks to conduct partnerships and agreements with local financial institutions offering financing solutions that enable local exporters, therefore contributing to the growth of local exports in international markets.

Line of Credit (International): ​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​T​he bank conducts partnerships and agreements with international financial institutions (Banks, Non-bank financial institutions, Multilateral development banks, etc) offering solutions that enable international buyers to overcome financing challenges, which contributes to the growth of local exports

Pre-Export Financing: ​​Liquidity could be an issue for some exporters who purchase production inputs from the local market during the pre-export phase to meet the demands of the foreign buyer. This product, therefore, provides financing that enables exporters to purchase production inputs required for export.​

Discounting: To accelerate the exporter's collection of their export proceeds before their maturity date, this product has been developed to contribute to the acceleration of the collection and provide the cash liquidity necessary to cover the cash flow gap that exporters may experience between the export period and the collection date.

Supply Chain: ​​​​Improving payment conditions between exporters and suppliers is critical. The product offers export-dependent enterprises short-term revolving financing while handling complicated payments and extended payment terms for supply chain credit accounts.​

Import Finance: To keep up with the demand from international markets for local products, we offer this product to enable local exporters to acquire international raw materials and help accelerate the production process.

Working Capital Finance: ​Some exporters face challenges in operational expenditures for export requests. As a result, this product provides liquidity that fulfills short-term export-related needs, thereby boosting export growth.

Structured Finance for International Projects: We provide this product in the form of medium- to long-term loans to support companies’ ability to carry out international projects that incorporate local goods or services, considering the involvement of Saudi companies in the implementation of significant international projects in various fields.

International Buyer’s Credit: Given that Saudi products and services compete with their foreign counterparts on the global market, we developed this product to give foreign importers short- and medium-term financing options when purchasing Saudi products and services. This product also makes it easier to collect debts without the need to conduct financial transactions.

Export Credit Insurance Policy: ​We offer this product to provide insurance solutions that cover the exporter's portfolio of buyers through either comprehensive cover or a specific cover, which helps reduce default risks. This enables the local exporter and provides a layer of protection from the risks of non-payment by buyers or banks.

Letter of Credit Insurance Policy: ​With local financial institutions facing the risk of default by international banks issuing letters of credit related to local exports, we offer this product to help improve the acceptance of Letter of Credit received by local financial institutions from foreign banks as well as facilitate access to local exports globally.​

Buyer’s Credit Insurance Policy:​To provide financial institutions with the insurance required to finance purchases of local goods and services by international importers, we offer this product that covers the risk of importers defaulting on payments and contributes to increasing the competitiveness of local products internationally.​

Letter of Guarantee: ​To enable national enterprises, we developed this product to fulfill the guarantees outlined in the project implementation criteria and increase the chance of winning international bids.​

content.name: Economic Cities And Special Zones Authority (ECZA)
content.text: ECZA enhances the Kingdom’s global competitiveness by launching and enabling a range of cities and special economic zones that provide an attractive regulatory environment for investment. ECZA supports targeted competitive incentives and enablers, highly efficient integrated government services, and a stimulating living environment with global quality of life standards. The lunch took place in four special economic zones, including:

content.name: 1- King Abdullah Economic City (KAEC) SEZ
content.text: Sectors of Opportunity:
list: Automobile supply chain and assembly.
Consumer goods.
ICT (Electronic light manufacturing).
Pharmaceuticals.
MedTech.
Logistics.

content.name: 2- Ras Al-Khair Special Economic Zone
content.text: Sectors of Opportunity:
list: Shipbuilding and MRO.
Rig platforms and MRO.

content.name: 3- Jazan Special Economic Zone
content.text: Sectors of Opportunity:
list: Food processing.
Metals conversion.
Logistic.

content.name: 4- Cloud Computing SEZ
content.text: Sectors of Opportunity:
list: Cloud computing.

content.name: Access Attractive Economic Incentives Across the SEZ Network:
list: Corporate income tax reductions.
A variety of withholding tax exemptions.
Deferred customs duties on goods entering the SEZ.
Expat levy ensuring fees exemption for employees and their families in the zone.
VAT exemptions based on sector/activity criteria.
Flexible and supportive regulations around foreign talent.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Economic Cities and Special Zones Authority (ECZA) for more details:

link.name: Economic Cities And Special Zones Authority Websit

content.name: Saudi Made Program
content.text: Which aims to promote national goods and services to become the preferred option locally and internationally in collaboration with a group of public and private partners.

content.name: Provided Benefits:
list: Marketing for products and local brands
Use of "Saudi Made" logo on products
Workshops participation,
Connecting with all government stakeholder entities
Knowledge sharing and collaboration

enablerItem.name: The Contracting Method Of Localization Of Industry & Knowledge Transfer (LIKT)

content.name: Local content & Government Procurement Authority
content.text: Industry localization and knowledge transfer agreements are agreements directed to investors who own leading technologies around the world to motivate them to transfer technology and knowledge to the Kingdom in exchange for a government purchase guarantee, the percentage and duration of which are agreed upon according to a feasibility study that considers the investment returns on the government commitment as well as on the investor.

content.name: Economical Impact:
list: Developing local content through the impact of the establishment of factories by major international companies within the Kingdom as well as creating jobs, transferring knowledge, and creating new local supply chains.
Attracting foreign investments.
Reducing dependence on imported products and creating new opportunities to export local products.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Local Content & Government Procurement Authority for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: Tawteen program is set to facilitate, enhance, and finance supply chain localization opportunities of the Kingdom’s industrial sector. To achieve this, SIDF established partnerships with leading companies in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia to enable the switch to source locally manufactured products and spare parts. Through preferential financing solutions, the Tawteen program will help stimulate investment activities and support the national and local content strategy.

content.name: Tawteen Objectives:
list: Stimulate domestic and foreign investment to increase local content.
Highlight localization opportunities.
Measure and maximize SIDF Local Content contribution.

content.name: Benefits:
list: Longer tenure of a minimum of 7 years.
Longer grace period of up to 24 months.
Fast track for projects with purchase agreements.

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:

content.name: Saudi Industrial Development Fund – SIDF
content.text: This program contributes to the improvement of local developers in the field of Renewable Energy’s production and promote the quality of products specialized mainly in Solar and Wind Energy. Thus, aligning them with the local and global demands through three tracks of financing:

content.name: Financing Renewable Energy Components Manufacturing
list: Longer tenor (up to 15 years).
Including grace period (up to 36 months).
Financing up to 75% of project cost.
Alignment with the Renewable Energy Projects Development Office (REPDO).

content.name: Financing Distributed Solar Electrical Generation:
list: Longer tenor (up to 15 years).
Including grace period (up to 36 months).
Financing up to 75% of project cost.
Available for projects owners and developers in commercial and agriculture sectors.

content.name: Financing Renewable Independent Power Producers (IPPs)
list: Longer repayment period (up to 20 years).
Including grace period (up to 36 months).

content.textDone: You can visit the website of Saudi Industrial Development Fund for more details:
